comment.body:
After two escalations with Stripe Support I received a reply from Thomas in the dev team:

"We do see those requests and they are caused by the extension itself apparently injecting a script in our own iframe which violates our own CSP rules. We made an infrastructure change on our end to make those CSP reports requests a lot faster. This should alleviate the issue though it could happen again over time as it depends a lot on the volume of requests those servers get."

So AdGuard still has a negative impact on Stripe-powered payment forms for Firefox users.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

Hello, I already solved the problem, the problem was not caused by any filter, the problem is because of the DNS server that I selected.  I was using Google DNS but now I use Cisco OpenDNS and I no longer have problems watching my movies.  Thanks anyway

comment.body:
That's related to this issue - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/ExtendedCss/issues/166 and "caused" by third-party filter list.
As a temporary solution, please add this rule:
```adblock
bloomberg.com#@#body:not(:-abp-has(div[class*="player" i][class*="_container"], #root .datastrip)) > div[id^="sp_message_container"]
```
to user rules.

```adblock
||geo.dailymotion.com/player/x15mh.js$domain=programme-television.org
```

issue.title: live.bilibili.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Windows

### AdGuard version

7.12

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances  pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

Enter a hot bilibili live broadcast room to reproduce

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Chinese filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
bilibili's live broadcast room will carry out p2p upload. use "live.bilibili.com#%#//scriptlet('nowebrtc')" can stop it.
2. Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/69903376/232044513-1a81bb50-9261-43c9-9ccf-fedf6be83192.png)

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: www.etsy.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.etsy.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.etsy.com%2F) ### Comment Username: @lewisje > A variety of third-party DNS providers, along with the regular AdGuard DNS, return the correct IP addresses for Etsy, but AdGuard Family returns 94.140.14.35 as the IP address for www.etsy.com; that turns out to be the blocked-site page, which fails with a privacy error because the blocked-site page does not have a TLS certificate for etsy.com and that domain has HSTS (one of the bundled HSTS pins in recent browsers), so the TLS failure cannot be bypassed (I forgot to open the "Advanced" button when taking that screenshot, but that's basically what that message said). > > I fail to see how Etsy qualifies as "adult content" worthy of blocking via the family filter. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/3DYNmSv.png)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/kbinThc.png)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- Platform: | AdGuard DNS Family Browser: | Edge Filters: | Other:
AdGuard DNS Other extensions used: | uBlock Origin, Windows Defender

issue.title: www.etsy.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.etsy.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.etsy.com%2F) ### Comment Username: @lewisje > A variety of third-party DNS providers, along with the regular AdGuard DNS, return the correct IP addresses for Etsy, but AdGuard Family returns 94.140.14.35 as the IP address for www.etsy.com; that turns out to be the blocked-site page, which fails with a privacy error because the blocked-site page does not have a TLS certificate for etsy.com and that domain has HSTS (one of the bundled HSTS pins in recent browsers), so the TLS failure cannot be bypassed (I forgot to open the "Advanced" button when taking that screenshot, but that's basically what that message said). > > I fail to see how Etsy qualifies as "adult content" worthy of blocking via the family filter. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/3DYNmSv.png)
